title: President's Scholarship
Description:: The President's Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at Indiana Wesleyan University.  You must be a graduate of a Grant County high school to be considered for this renewable award.

Provided By:: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Inc.
title: Motorola/IEEE Components, Pkg. and Mfg. Technology Graduate Fellowship
Description:: The Motorola/IEEE Components, Packaging and Manufacturing Technology Society Graduate Fellowship for Research on Electronic Packaging is available to graduate students pursuing a Ph.D in electronic packaging.  You must have completed at least one year of graduate level coursework to be eligible for this award.

Provided By:: Institute of Real Estate Management Foundation
title: Paul H. Rittle, Sr. Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Paul H. Rittle, Sr. Memorial Scholarship is available to individuals currently employed in some aspect of the real estate field who are committed to gaining the Certified Property Manager (CPM) or Accredited Residential Manager (ARM) certification.  You must be a U.S. or Canadian citizen and demonstrate financial need, a commitment to real estate management as a career, character, and academic performance to be eligible for this award.  Three letters of recommendation and a brief personal letter are also required.

Provided By:: Institute of Real Estate Management Foundation
title: Donald M. Furbush Scholarship
Description:: The Donald M. Furbush Scholarship is available to individuals currently employed in real estate management who are committed to gaining the Certified Property Manager (CPM) or Accredited Residential Manager (ARM) certification.  You must be nominated by an IREM chapter and work in the boundaries of your nominating chapter to be eligible for this award.  Selection will be based on your commitment to professional excellence as demonstrated by accomplishments in the real estate industry and community, financial need, the strength of your IREM chapter recommendation, and your personal commitment to gaining a CPM or ARM certification.  U.S. or Canadian citizenship is also required.  Applications are evaluated in even-numbered years for nominees interested in pursuing the CPM designation and in odd-number years for nominees interested in pursuing the ARM certification.

title: Beinecke African Scholarship Program
Description:: The Beinecke African Scholarship Program is open to African students who are pursuing graduate study at a University in the United States.  You must be majoring in conservation or wildlife ecology to be eligible for this award.

title: John W. Garrett, Class of 1895, Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The John W. Garrett, Class of 1895, Memorial Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Geoffrey S. Garstin ’26 Scholarship
Description:: The Geoffrey S. Garstin ’26 Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Christian Gauss, Class of 1958, Scholarship
Description:: The Christian Gauss, Class of 1958, Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Gordon S. Gavan ’30 Student Aid Fund
Description:: The Gordon S. Gavan ’30 Student Aid Fund is open to students attending Princeton University. You must be majoring in English, art or architecture in order to qualify for this award.

title: William Rome Gelston Scholarship
Description:: The William Rome Gelston Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Kenneth W. Gemmill Scholarship
Description:: The Kenneth W. Gemmill Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Karl George Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Karl George Memorial Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: A. F. Gerstell and Robert S. Gerstell Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The A. F. Gerstell and Robert S. Gerstell Memorial Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Charles Paul Giessing Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Charles Paul Giessing Memorial Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Philip Lee Gill, Class of 1905, Scholarship
Description:: The Philip Lee Gill, Class of 1905, Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Eugene P. Gillespie '40 Scholarship Fund
Description:: The Eugene P. Gillespie '40 Scholarship Fund is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Wilfred H. Gillon Scholarship
Description:: The Wilfred H. Gillon Scholarship is open to students attending Princeton University.

title: Leadership Essay Contest
Description:: The Leadership Essay Contest is available to junior officers, 0 - 4 (LCDR/MAJ) and below, from the U.S. Navy, U.S. Marine Corps, and U.S. Coast Guard.  You must write a maximum 3000 - word essay on any subject related to the roles of leadership and character in America's Sea Services to be considered for this award.

title: Presidential Scholarship - Siena College
Description:: The Presidential Scholarship is open to entering full-time freshmen at Siena College.  You must have complete at least 20 academic units with a minimum 90 academic average, score a minimum 1150 SAT / 25 ACT score, and receive an admissions committee nomination to be eligible for this award.

title: Kristin Runyon Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Kristin Runyon Memorial Scholarship is open to nursing students who are residents of Franklin County.  You must have a minimum GPA of 2.8 in order to qualify for this award.

title: American Indian Scholarship - Iowa State University
Description:: The American Indian Scholarship is open to incoming freshmen at Iowa State University who are at least one-quarter Native American, have high financial need and are not receiving tribal benefits.  You must provide documentation of American Indian status to be considered for this award.

title: Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program
Description:: The Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowship Program is open to students with limited or no prior experience in the United States.  To be considered, you must have earned an undergraduate degree, have at least five years of full - time professional experience, demonstrate leadership qualities, and have a record of public service in the community.  Fellows will participate in a year of non - degree graduate - level study, leadership development, and professional collaboration with U.S. counterparts.

title: Michael Weiner Scholarship for Labor Studies
Description:: The Michael Weiner Scholarship for Labor Studies is available to  full-time students.  You must be a graduate or law student with a demonstrated commitment to the labor movement in order to qualify for this award.

title: Zell Scholarship
Description:: The Zell Scholarship is available to students who are currently enrolled or plan to enroll in a four or five year plumbing apprenticeship program.  Full-time employees of a licensed plumbing contractor are also eligible to apply.

title: Food Science Innovation Challenge
Description:: The Food Science Innovation Challenge is open to have completed at least one year of a food science, nutrition, culinary or engineering related program at an accredited technical college or four-year university.  You must submit a proposal for a food product innovation or solving an industry problem based on the use of Citri-Fi 125 in order to be considered for this award.

title: For the People Scholarship
Description:: The For the People Scholarship is open to first year law students.  You must demonstrate involvement and commitment to your community by answering the three essay questions listed on the sponsor's website in order to be considered for this award.
